Name: Raising the maximum age to apply to become a firefighter.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to raising the maximum age to apply to become a firefighter
BodyName: Committee on Fire and Emergency Management

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management

Summary: This bill would raise the eligible age for applying to become a firefighter from 29 to 30.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      Section 1. Paragraph 3 of subdivision a of section 15-103 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to read as follows:
      3. Shall have passed his or her [eighteenth] 18th birthday but not his or her [twenty-ninth] 31st birthday on the date of the filing of his or her application for civil service examination and not his or her 36th birthday on the date of his or her commencing employment as a firefighter. [No person who qualifies under this requirement shall be disqualified from membership in the department because of having passed his or her twenty-ninth birthday subsequent to the filing of his or her application.] However no person shall be appointed unless he or she shall have attained his or her [twenty-first] 21st birthday.
      ï¿½2. This local law takes effect immediately.
